data.title: Nice Surprise :)
data.text: Looking for lunch, we came across this place upstairs on 4th street in Santa Rosa.  Very clean with excellent ambiance.  The menus was more limited then other Thai places, but quality over quantity bodes well.  I always rate Thai by the taste of Thai Fried rice, and this was one of the better places we've enjoyed.  The YELP ratings were average, but we will definitely be back.  It's a real competitive area, with lots of dining options, as well as other higher rated Thai in the area.  I dont know how it could get much better

data.title: Good food
data.text: This restaurant has been in the same location for over 20 years. The food is consistently good and the help is friendly.

data.title: Great Fresh Thai -  Worth the Wait!
data.text: We stopped on a busy Friday night.  We called a half hour ahead  to make a reservation but really did not need it.  Our orders took about 30 minutes since they were very busy,  We felt our  food was worth the wait tho.  We had green curry and panang and it was delicious.  Prices were reasonable - $14 a plate.  The dishes were filled with fresh veggies cooked just right. Wish we lived in the area since we would love to frequent this place.

data.title: Great food recommended by the Quilt Shop
data.text: Love the Angel Wings and the lunch was over the top good. A bit hard to find. Up the stairs and around the corner but we'll worth the effort.  Great service also.

data.title: Thai delight hidden upstairs downtown
data.text: Tucked away in downtown Santa Rosa between Belly and Tex Wasabi's back doors there is an elevator which takes you upstairs to this wonderful Thai restaurant. There is even a back section in which you must remove your shoes and you sit on cushions on the floor. The ginger chicken dish was very flavorful tonight and the angel wings (deep-fried chicken wings stuffed with ground pork and silver noodles) are always tasty. Spring rolls are solid here too.

data.title: My favorite Thai restaurant in Santa Rosa
data.text: This is the best place for lunch!  Their lunch specials are incredible, and offer a ton of fresh food.  Try the pumpkin curry, chicken or beef satay, honeyed pork, green papaya salad, or really any curry.  The sticky rice is always a favorite.  Affordable, and amazing!

data.title: Good and Bad
data.text: Fun location, good appetizers, must try the angel wings!  Entrées were a bust, very plain Thai food.  Great service.

data.title: Ridiculously good
data.text:
We stumbled on this place. A single door to an almost hidden staircase up to this hidden gem. As you emerge at the top of the staircase, you'll find yourself in a wonderful little place adorned with Thai decorations. 

They have a great and familiar selection of Thai food. When our first dish came out, I forked a piece of broccoli out of a rice noodle, Shrimp and vegetable dish. I was astounded at how well seasoned and flavorful that bite of *broccoli* was. 

That bite was followed by many more wonderful surprises of this astoundingly good dish layered with favor after flavor as any good Thai dish should be. And this happened not just with the first dish, but every dish at the table!

Very reasonably priced. Helpful staff. Great food. All in this hidden gem. 

Go and enjoy.

data.title: the appetizers were very good, the entrees ok
data.text: We tried many things at Thai house and liked the appetizers the best--particularly the one with lettuce leaves, coconut, lime, peppers, ginger,peanuts, dried shrimp and tamarind sauce (can't remember the name). The spring rolls were also good and fresh. The eggplant with basil was ok, as was the cashew chicken.

data.title: We enjoyed our lunch and the service
data.text: Dimitri had the Pad Thai with pork ($12) and Audre had the small Tom Kha soup with tofu ($5). Both dishes were very good. We liked our server and thought that the room was nicely decorated. We also had one sticky rice pudding which Dimitri liked. We spent $23.92 for lunch and were happy.

data.title: Meh Thai
data.text:
I dined here with colleagues last week. The first impression was probably a good impression for the rest of the experience. Meh. The restaurant is on the second floor of a downtown building. UP a narrow and steep staircase you enter a darkly lit room. Had I been in Bangkok, I would have expected to be presented counterfeit merchandise. But I was in Santa Rosa and this was a restaurant. 

We were seated immediately. There weren't many people int he restaurant and the menu seemed to be a mix between Thai and Chinese of some sort.  I started with Tom Yum Gum soup. I found it unusually greasy and a strange orange color. It wasn't very spicy and just tasted, well different.

We shared main courses which included fried duck (full of carcass bones  that you had to dissect), a peanut noodle plate (not Pad Thai) that was unspectacular and a vegetarian dish that was equally unspectacular.  A Singha washed it all down.

To be honest, it was disappointing. Thai food is among the best in Asia, second in my opinion, to Japanese.  But Thai House missed the mark for me and I won't be back.

Service was courteous but not particularly enthusiastic. It was sort of along the same line as the atmosphere and the food. Mediocre.

data.title: Loving me some Thai!!
data.text: While visiting a friend in town, she took me to her favorite Thai place.  How right she was!  We had an amazing dinner at the Thai House.  The summer rolls and papaya salad were so good.  I'm still craving them!  Great curry dishes and my spicy eggplant was not to be missed.  Service was quick and professional. The portions were huge.  Sharing is a must!  We ended our meal with the sticky rice pudding and mango.  The presentation of our meal was beautiful.  Check out the dessert picture.  Looking forward to my next visit to Santa Rosa and the Thai House!

data.title: I LOVE THIS PLACE!
data.text: I've been going to the Thai House for years and love love love it! They allow you to sit on the floor surrounded by pillows, and coupled with their amazing honey pork and curries it's a 100% win. Spice is added to your liking. Great menu!

data.title: Delicious and authentic food!
data.text: This restaurant is owned by a Thai family and they cook with fresh produce daily. They have refurbished so it is pleasant inside. They offer Thai style seating on the floor but have tables as well. The food is fantastic! Presentation is nicely done as well. They offer lunch specials so you can get a little bit of a few items! Don't miss it...delish!

data.title: Exceptional!
data.text: We eat Thai food often and this was delicious.  My husband said of his ginger duck, "this is the best Thai dish I've ever had outside of Thailand".   He never says things like that.   My green curry with chicken was so flavorful!  Great service too.

data.title: Great Thai
data.text: Love this place, always has delicious food and a nice atmosphere...it holds a special place in my heart as we went here for dinner the night of my engagement.

data.title: May favorite Thai restaurant!
data.text:
Since finding this restaurant hiding away up a staircase in downtown Santa Rosa (it is across from La Rosa on 4th Street), it has become my favorite Thai food restaurant and one of my "go to" places in Santa Rosa.

It looks like it's going to be "seedy" coming up the stairs, and the space is obviously somehwat old, but the restaurant itself has a lovely ambiance with large fountain against one wall in the main room and a very lovely and peaceful more traditional Thai seating area facing the front of the building (must sit on floor without shoes in this area).

Really not sure what others are finding fault with here. The food is fresh and authentically prepared and the prices are great for the quality of the food. I did takeout that first time and got Tom-Kha (FABULOUS soup) and their Eggplant entree. Loved the food and the prices are very good (soup and eggplant together were about $9). My mother came back with a group and raved about it after--she got the coconut shrimp and Hawaiian Fried Rice--others in the group got Currys and everyone loved their meal. Since then I have probably been here 8 or 9 times and never had a bad meal yet. 

Give it a try!

data.title: Tasty food, but mixed overall
data.text: We ordered corn cakes & satay beef for appetizers.  Curry & ginger vegetable & bbq chicken for entrees.  Heavy on cilantro, a little light on chili.  Would've been a good meal, but the carpet was dirty, the decor run down, and the sole waiter overwhelmed.  As I said, mixed experience.

data.title: Great value, great food.
data.text:
Polite staff.
Good food for the price, good variety on the menu.
Authentic Thai restaurant- taking your shoes off when entering makes it feel authentic.
Recommend if in Santa Rosa.

data.title: Don't Go Up The Stairs!!
data.text: Miserable food, drafty and aged interior, lackluster service, and absolutely no reason on earth to be in business. What a mistake we made.  There were four of us and we desperately tried not to share.
